import sqlite3
from pathlib import Path
from typing import Optional, Dict, Any


class TodoDB:
    """
    Simple SQLite based Todo database.
    All operations open a fresh connection, execute the query and close the connection.
    This guarantees that no file‚Äëhandle stays open after a test, preventing
    PermissionError on file removal.
    """

    _SCHEMA = """
    PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON;

    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS task_type (
        type_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
        type_name TEXT    NOT NULL UNIQUE CHECK (length(type_name) <= 30)
    );

    INSERT OR IGNORE INTO task_type (type_name) VALUES
        ('Bug'),
        ('Idea');

    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS status (
        status_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
        status_name TEXT    NOT NULL UNIQUE CHECK (length(status_name) <= 30)
    );

    INSERT OR IGNORE INTO status (status_name) VALUES
        ('New'),
        ('Open'),
        ('In Review'),
        ('Resolved'),
        ('Closed');

    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS task (
        task_id      INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
        title        TEXT    NOT NULL CHECK (length(title) <= 150),
        description  TEXT    NOT NULL,
        type_id      INTEGER NOT NULL,
        status_id    INTEGER NOT NULL,
        created_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
        updated_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),

        CONSTRAINT fk_task_type
            FOREIGN KEY (type_id)
            REFERENCES task_type (type_id)
            ON DELETE RESTRICT
            ON UPDATE CASCADE,

        CONSTRAINT fk_task_status
            FOREIGN KEY (status_id)
            REFERENCES status (status_id)
            ON DELETE RESTRICT
            ON UPDATE CASCADE
    );

    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS task_history (
        history_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
        task_id      INTEGER NOT NULL,
        old_status_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
        new_status_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
        changed_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),

        CONSTRAINT fk_hist_task
            FOREIGN KEY (task_id)
            REFERENCES task (task_id)
            ON DELETE CASCADE
            ON UPDATE CASCADE,

        CONSTRAINT fk_hist_old_status
            FOREIGN KEY (old_status_id)
            REFERENCES status (status_id)
            ON DELETE RESTRICT
            ON UPDATE CASCADE,

        CONSTRAINT fk_hist_new_status
            FOREIGN KEY (new_status_id)
            REFERENCES status (status_id)
            ON DELETE RESTRICT
            ON UPDATE CASCADE
    );

    CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_task_title ON task(title);
    CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_task_type_status ON task(type_id, status_id);
    CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_hist_task ON task_history(task_id);
    """

    def __init__(self, db_path: str):
        self.db_path = Path(db_path)
        # Ensure the DB file exists and schema is present
        self._initialize_schema()

    # --------------------------------------------------------------------- #
    # internal helpers
    # --------------------------------------------------------------------- #
    def _connect(self) -> sqlite3.Connection:
        """Open a new connection with row_factory set for dict‚Äëlike access."""
        conn = sqlite3.connect(str(self.db_path))
        conn.row_factory = sqlite3.Row
        return conn

    def _initialize_schema(self) -> None:
        """Create tables if they do not exist."""
        with self._connect() as conn:
            conn.executescript(self._SCHEMA)

    # --------------------------------------------------------------------- #
    # public API
    # --------------------------------------------------------------------- #
    def add_task(
        self,
        title: str,
        description: str,
        type_name: str = "Bug",
        status_name: str = "New",
    ) -> int:
        """Insert a new task and return its generated ID."""
        with self._connect() as conn:
            cur = conn.cursor()
            cur.execute(
                """
                INSERT INTO task (title, description, type_id, status_id)
                VALUES (
                    ?, ?,
                    (SELECT type_id FROM task_type WHERE type_name = ?),
                    (SELECT status_id FROM status WHERE status_name = ?)
                )
                """,
                (title, description, type_name, status_name),
            )
            conn.commit()
            return cur.lastrowid

    def get_task(self, task_id: int) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
        """Return a task row enriched with type and status names."""
        with self._connect() as conn:
            cur = conn.cursor()
            cur.execute(
                """
                SELECT
                    t.task_id,
                    t.title,
                    t.description,
                    tt.type_name,
                    s.status_name,
                    t.created_at,
                    t.updated_at
                FROM task t
                JOIN task_type tt ON t.type_id = tt.type_id
                JOIN status s ON t.status_id = s.status_id
                WHERE t.task_id = ?
                """,
                (task_id,),
            )
            row = cur.fetchone()
            return dict(row) if row else None

    def update_status(self, task_id: int, new_status_name: str) -> None:
        """Change the status of a task and record the change in history."""
        with self._connect() as conn:
            cur = conn.cursor()

            old_status_id = old["status_id"]

                """
                UPDATE task
                SET status_id = ?, updated_at = datetime('now')
                WHERE task_id = ?
                """,
                (new_status_id, task_id),
            )

            # Insert history entry
            cur.execute(
                """
                INSERT INTO task_history (task_id, old_status_id, new_status_id)
                VALUES (?, ?, ?)
                """,
                (task_id, old_status_id, new_status_id),
            )
            conn.commit()

import sqlite3
from pathlib import Path
from typing import Optional, Dict, Any, List

# Default database file used by the application and the tests
DB_FILE = "todolist.db"


class TodoDB:
    """
    Simple SQLite based Todo database.

    All public methods open a fresh connection, execute the query and close the
    connection.  This guarantees that no file‚Äëhandle stays open after a test,
    preventing ``PermissionError`` when the temporary file is removed.
    """

    _SCHEMA = """
    PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON;

    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS task_type (
        type_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
        type_name TEXT    NOT NULL UNIQUE CHECK (length(type_name) <= 30)
    );

    INSERT OR IGNORE INTO task_type (type_name) VALUES
        ('Bug'),
        ('Idea');

    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS status (
        status_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
        status_name TEXT    NOT NULL UNIQUE CHECK (length(status_name) <= 30)
    );

    INSERT OR IGNORE INTO status (status_name) VALUES
        ('New'),
        ('Open'),
        ('In Review'),
        ('Resolved'),
        ('Closed');

    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS task (
        task_id      INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
        title        TEXT    NOT NULL CHECK (length(title) <= 150),
        description  TEXT    NOT NULL,
        type_id      INTEGER NOT NULL,
        status_id    INTEGER NOT NULL,
        created_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
        updated_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),

        CONSTRAINT fk_task_type
            FOREIGN KEY (type_id)
            REFERENCES task_type (type_id)
            ON DELETE RESTRICT
            ON UPDATE CASCADE,

        CONSTRAINT fk_task_status
            FOREIGN KEY (status_id)
            REFERENCES status (status_id)
            ON DELETE RESTRICT
            ON UPDATE CASCADE
    );

    CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS task_history (
        history_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
        task_id      INTEGER NOT NULL,
        old_status_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
        new_status_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
        changed_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),

        CONSTRAINT fk_hist_task
            FOREIGN KEY (task_id)
            REFERENCES task (task_id)
            ON DELETE CASCADE
            ON UPDATE CASCADE,

        CONSTRAINT fk_hist_old_status
            FOREIGN KEY (old_status_id)
            REFERENCES status (status_id)
            ON DELETE RESTRICT
            ON UPDATE CASCADE,

        CONSTRAINT fk_hist_new_status
            FOREIGN KEY (new_status_id)
            REFERENCES status (status_id)
            ON DELETE RESTRICT
            ON UPDATE CASCADE
    );

    CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_task_title ON task(title);
    CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_task_type_status ON task(type_id, status_id);
    CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_hist_task ON task_history(task_id);
    """

    def __init__(self, db_path: str = DB_FILE):
        self.db_path = Path(db_path)
        self._initialize_schema()

    # --------------------------------------------------------------------- #
    # internal helpers
    # --------------------------------------------------------------------- #
    def _connect(self) -> sqlite3.Connection:
        """Open a new connection with row_factory set for dict‚Äëlike access."""
        conn = sqlite3.connect(str(self.db_path))
        conn.row_factory = sqlite3.Row
        return conn

    def _initialize_schema(self) -> None:
        """Create tables if they do not exist."""
        with self._connect() as conn:
            conn.executescript(self._SCHEMA)

    # --------------------------------------------------------------------- #
    # public API
    # --------------------------------------------------------------------- #
    def add_task(
        self,
        title: str,
        description: str,
        type_name: str = "Bug",
        status_name: str = "New",
    ) -> int:
        """
        Insert a new task and return its generated ID.
        """
        with self._connect() as conn:
            cur = conn.cursor()
            cur.execute(
                """
                INSERT INTO task (title, description, type_id, status_id)
                VALUES (
                    ?, ?,
                    (SELECT type_id FROM task_type WHERE type_name = ?),
                    (SELECT status_id FROM status WHERE status_name = ?)
                )
                """,
                (title, description, type_name, status_name),
            )
            conn.commit()
            return cur.lastrowid

    def get_task(self, task_id: int) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:
        """
        Return a task row enriched with type and status names.
        """
        with self._connect() as conn:
            cur = conn.cursor()
            cur.execute(
                """
                SELECT
                    t.task_id,
                    t.title,
                    t.description,
                    tt.type_name,
                    s.status_name,
                    t.created_at,
                    t.updated_at
                FROM task t
                JOIN task_type tt ON t.type_id = tt.type_id
                JOIN status s ON t.status_id = s.status_id
                WHERE t.task_id = ?
                """,
                (task_id,),
            )
            row = cur.fetchone()
            return dict(row) if row else None

    def update_status(self, task_id: int, new_status_name: str) -> None:
        """
        Change the status of a task and record the change in history.
        """
        with self._connect() as conn:
            cur = conn.cursor()
            # Resolve new status id
            cur.execute(
                "SELECT status_id FROM status WHERE status_name = ?", (new_status_name,)
            )
            new = cur.fetchone()
            if not new:
                raise ValueError(f"Unknown status '{new_status_name}'")
            new_status_id = new["status_id"]

            # Resolve old status id
            cur.execute(
                "SELECT status_id FROM task WHERE task_id = ?", (task_id,)
            )
            old = cur.fetchone()
            if not old:
                raise ValueError(f"Task {task_id} does not exist")
            old_status_id = old["status_id"]

            # Update task
            cur.execute(
                """
                UPDATE task
                SET status_id = ?, updated_at = datetime('now')
                WHERE task_id = ?
                """,
                (new_status_id, task_id),
            )

            # Insert history entry
            cur.execute(
                """
                INSERT INTO task_history (task_id, old_status_id, new_status_id)
                VALUES (?, ?, ?)
                """,
                (task_id, old_status_id, new_status_id),
            )
            conn.commit()

    def list_tasks(self) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
        """
        Return all tasks with human‚Äëreadable type and status.
        """
        with self._connect() as conn:
            cur = conn.cursor()
            cur.execute(
                """
                SELECT
                    t.task_id,
                    t.title,
                    t.description,
                    tt.type_name,
                    s.status_name,
                    t.created_at,
                    t.updated_at
                FROM task t
                JOIN task_type tt ON t.type_id = tt.type_id
                JOIN status s ON t.status_id = s.status_id
                ORDER BY t.task_id ASC
                """
            )
            rows = cur.fetchall()
            return [dict(r) for r in rows]

import sys
from pathlib import Path

from PyQt5 import QtCore, QtGui, QtWidgets

from db import TodoDB, DB_FILE

# -------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Helper dialog to add a new task
# -------------------------------------------------------------------------
class AddTaskDialog(QtWidgets.QDialog):
    def __init__(self, parent=None):
        super().__init__(parent)
        self.setWindowTitle("Neuen Eintrag hinzuf√ºgen")
        self.setModal(True)
        self.resize(400, 250)

        # Layout
        layout = QtWidgets.QVBoxLayout(self)

        # Title
        self.title_edit = QtWidgets.QLineEdit(self)
        self.title_edit.setPlaceholderText("Titel")
        layout.addWidget(self.title_edit)

        # Description
        self.desc_edit = QtWidgets.QPlainTextEdit(self)
        self.desc_edit.setPlaceholderText("Beschreibung")
        layout.addWidget(self.desc_edit)

        # Type selector
        self.type_combo = QtWidgets.QComboBox(self)
        self.type_combo.addItems(["Bug", "Idea"])
        layout.addWidget(self.type_combo)

        # Buttons
        btn_box = QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox(
            QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox.Ok | QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox.Cancel,
            parent=self,
        )
        btn_box.accepted.connect(self.accept)
        btn_box.rejected.connect(self.reject)
        layout.addWidget(btn_box)

    def get_data(self):
        return {
            "title": self.title_edit.text().strip(),
            "description": self.desc_edit.toPlainText().strip(),
            "type_name": self.type_combo.currentText(),
        }

# -------------------------------------------------------------------------
# Main application window
# -------------------------------------------------------------------------
class MainWindow(QtWidgets.QMainWindow):
    def __init__(self, db_path: str = DB_FILE):
        super().__init__()
        self.setWindowTitle("Todo‚ÄëListe ‚Äì Bugs & Ideen")
        self.resize(800, 600)

        # Apply a simple glass‚Äëmorphism style
        self.setStyleSheet(
            """
            QMainWindow {
                background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.15);
                backdrop-filter: blur(12px);
            }
            QTableWidget {
                background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.25);
                border: none;
                gridline-color: rgba(0,0,0,0.1);
            }
            QHeaderView::section {
                background: rgba(255,255,255,0.3);
                padding: 4px;
                border: none;
            }
            QPushButton {
                background: rgba(255,255,255,0.3);
                border-radius: 6px;
                padding: 6px 12px;
            }
            QPushButton:hover {
                background: rgba(255,255,255,0.45);
                box-shadow: 0px 4px 12px rgba(0,0,0,0.2);
            }
            """
        )

        self.db = TodoDB(db_path)

        # Central widget
        central = QtWidgets.QWidget(self)
        self.setCentralWidget(central)
        vbox = QtWidgets.QVBoxLayout(central)

        # Toolbar
        toolbar = QtWidgets.QToolBar()
        toolbar.setMovable(False)
        self.addToolBar(toolbar)

        add_btn = QtWidgets.QAction("Eintrag hinzuf√ºgen", self)
        add_btn.triggered.connect(self.open_add_dialog)
        toolbar.addAction(add_btn)

        refresh_btn = QtWidgets.QAction("Aktualisieren", self)
        refresh_btn.triggered.connect(self.load_tasks)
        toolbar.addAction(refresh_btn)

        # Table
        self.table = QtWidgets.QTableWidget(self)
        self.table.setColumnCount(5)
        self.table.setHorizontalHeaderLabels(
            ["NR", "Titel", "Beschreibung", "Typ", "Status"]
        )
        self.table.horizontalHeader().setStretchLastSection(True)
        self.table.setEditTriggers(QtWidgets.QAbstractItemView.NoEditTriggers)
        self.table.setSelectionBehavior(QtWidgets.QAbstractItemView.SelectRows)
        self.table.setSelectionMode(QtWidgets.QAbstractItemView.SingleSelection)
        self.table.cellDoubleClicked.connect(self.change_status)
        vbox.addWidget(self.table)

        self.load_tasks()

    # -----------------------------------------------------------------
    # Data handling
    # -----------------------------------------------------------------
    def load_tasks(self):
        self.table.setRowCount(0)
        tasks = self.db.list_tasks()
        for task in tasks:
            row = self.table.rowCount()
            self.table.insertRow(row)
            self.table.setItem(row, 0, QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem(str(task["task_id"])))
            self.table.setItem(row, 1, QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem(task["title"]))
            self.table.setItem(row, 2, QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem(task["description"]))
            self.table.setItem(row, 3, QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem(task["type_name"]))
            self.table.setItem(row, 4, QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem(task["status_name"]))

    def open_add_dialog(self):
        dlg = AddTaskDialog(self)
        if dlg.exec_() == QtWidgets.QDialog.Accepted:
            data = dlg.get_data()
            if data["title"]:
                self.db.add_task(
                    title=data["title"],
                    description=data["description"],
                    type_name=data["type_name"],
                )
                self.load_tasks()

    def change_status(self, row: int, column: int):
        """Open a small popup to change the status of the selected task."""
        task_id_item = self.table.item(row, 0)
        if not task_id_item:
            return
        task_id = int(task_id_item.text())

        # Build a combo box with all possible statuses
        combo = QtWidgets.QComboBox()
        combo.addItems(["New", "Open", "In Review", "Resolved", "Closed"])
        current_status = self.table.item(row, 4).text()
        combo.setCurrentText(current_status)

        # Show it as a modal dialog
        dlg = QtWidgets.QDialog(self)
        dlg.setWindowTitle("Status √§ndern")
        dlg.setLayout(QtWidgets.QVBoxLayout())
        dlg.layout().addWidget(combo)

        btns = QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox(
            QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox.Ok | QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox.Cancel,
            parent=dlg,
        )
        btns.accepted.connect(dlg.accept)
        btns.rejected.connect(dlg.reject)
        dlg.layout().addWidget(btns)

        if dlg.exec_() == QtWidgets.QDialog.Accepted:
            new_status = combo.currentText()
            self.db.update_status(task_id, new_status)
            self.load_tasks()


def main():
    app = QtWidgets.QApplication(sys.argv)
    # Enable high‚Äëdpi scaling for crisp glass‚Äëmorphism look
    QtCore.QCoreApplication.setAttribute(QtCore.Qt.AA_EnableHighDpiScaling)
    win = MainWindow()
    win.show()
    sys.exit(app.exec_())


if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

"""
Entry point for the Todo‚ÄëList desktop application.
"""

import sys
import os
from PyQt5 import QtWidgets, QtGui, QtCore

# Ensure the package directory is on the import path
BASE_DIR = os.path.abspath(os.path.dirname(__file__))
if BASE_DIR not in sys.path:
    sys.path.append(BASE_DIR)

from todolist.db import TodoDB
from todolist.ui_mainwindow import MainWindow

def main() -> None:
    """Start the Qt application."""
    app = QtWidgets.QApplication(sys.argv)

    # Load the global stylesheet (glass‚Äëmorphism look)
    style_path = os.path.join(BASE_DIR, "todolist", "style.qss")
    if os.path.exists(style_path):
        with open(style_path, "r", encoding="utf-8") as f:
            app.setStyleSheet(f.read())

    # Initialise the database (default file in the same folder)
    db_path = os.path.join(BASE_DIR, "todolist.db")
    db = TodoDB(db_path)

    # Create and show the main window
    window = MainWindow(db)
    window.show()
    sys.exit(app.exec_())

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
```

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

"""
SQLite‚ÄëWrapper f√ºr die Todo‚ÄëList‚ÄëApplikation.
Stellt CRUD‚ÄëOperationen bereit und sorgt daf√ºr,
dass Verbindungen immer korrekt geschlossen werden.
"""

import sqlite3
import os
import threading
import html
import re
from typing import List, Dict, Any

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
# Hilfsfunktion: Eingaben sanitizen (Security‚ÄëTask SEC‚Äë001)
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
def _sanitize_text(text: str) -> str:
    """
    Entfernt potenziell gef√§hrliche HTML‚ÄëTags und Zeichen.
    """
    # Entferne spitze Klammern ‚Äì einfachste XSS‚ÄëPr√§vention
    return re.sub(r"[<>]", "", text)


class TodoDB:
    """
    Datenbank‚ÄëAbstraktions‚ÄëKlasse.
    Nutzt einen einzelnen Connection‚ÄëThread‚Äësicher (check_same_thread=False)
    und stellt Kontext‚ÄëManager‚ÄëUnterst√ºtzung bereit.
    """

    _lock = threading.Lock()

    def __init__(self, db_path: str = "todolist.db"):
        self.db_path = os.path.abspath(db_path)
        self.conn: sqlite3.Connection = sqlite3.connect(
            self.db_path, check_same_thread=False, isolation_level=None
        )
        self.conn.execute("PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON;")
        self._create_schema()

    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    # Schema‚ÄëErstellung (idempotent)
    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    def _create_schema(self) -> None:
        with self.conn:
            self.conn.executescript(
                """
                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS task_type (
                    type_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
                    type_name TEXT    NOT NULL UNIQUE CHECK (length(type_name) <= 30)
                );
                INSERT OR IGNORE INTO task_type (type_name) VALUES ('Bug'), ('Idea');

                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS status (
                    status_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
                    status_name TEXT    NOT NULL UNIQUE CHECK (length(status_name) <= 30)
                );
                INSERT OR IGNORE INTO status (status_name) VALUES
                    ('New'), ('Open'), ('In Review'), ('Resolved'), ('Closed');

                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS task (
                    task_id      INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
                    title        TEXT    NOT NULL CHECK (length(title) <= 150),
                    description  TEXT    NOT NULL,
                    type_id      INTEGER NOT NULL,
                    status_id    INTEGER NOT NULL,
                    created_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
                    updated_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
                    FOREIGN KEY (type_id)   REFERENCES task_type (type_id)   ON DELETE RESTRICT ON UPDATE CASCADE,
                    FOREIGN KEY (status_id) REFERENCES status    (status_id) ON DELETE RESTRICT ON UPDATE CASCADE
                );

                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS task_history (
                    history_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
                    task_id      INTEGER NOT NULL,
                    old_status_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
                    new_status_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
                    changed_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
                    FOREIGN KEY (task_id)       REFERENCES task (task_id)       ON DELETE CASCADE ON UPDATE CASCADE,
                    FOREIGN KEY (old_status_id) REFERENCES status (status_id) ON DELETE RESTRICT ON UPDATE CASCADE,
                    FOREIGN KEY (new_status_id) REFERENCES status (status_id) ON DELETE RESTRICT ON UPDATE CASCADE
                );

                CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_task_title ON task(title);
                CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_task_type_status ON task(type_id, status_id);
                CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_hist_task ON task_history(task_id);
                """
            )

    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    # Kontext‚ÄëManager‚ÄëMethoden
    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    def __enter__(self) -> "TodoDB":
        return self

    def __exit__(self, exc_type, exc_val, exc_tb) -> None:
        self.close()

    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    # √ñffentliche API
    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    def close(self) -> None:
        """Schlie√üt die Datenbankverbindung (idempotent)."""
        with self._lock:
            if getattr(self, "conn", None):
                self.conn.close()
                self.conn = None

    def _get_type_id(self, type_name: str) -> int:
        cur = self.conn.execute(
            "SELECT type_id FROM task_type WHERE type_name = ?", (type_name,)
        )
        row = cur.fetchone()
        if not row:
            raise ValueError(f"Unbekannter Task‚ÄëTyp: {type_name}")
        return row[0]

    def _get_status_id(self, status_name: str) -> int:
        cur = self.conn.execute(
            "SELECT status_id FROM status WHERE status_name = ?", (status_name,)
        )
        row = cur.fetchone()
        if not row:
            raise ValueError(f"Unbekannter Status: {status_name}")
        return row[0]

    def add_task(
        self,
        title: str,
        description: str,
        type_name: str = "Bug",
        status_name: str = "New",
    ) -> int:
        """
        F√ºgt einen neuen Task ein und gibt die erzeugte task_id zur√ºck.
        Eingaben werden sanitisiert (SEC‚Äë001).
        """
        title = _sanitize_text(title.strip())[:150]
        description = _sanitize_text(description.strip())

        type_id = self._get_type_id(type_name)
        status_id = self._get_status_id(status_name)

        with self._lock, self.conn:
            cur = self.conn.execute(
                """
                INSERT INTO task (title, description, type_id, status_id)
                VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?)
                """,
                (title, description, type_id, status_id),
            )
            task_id = cur.lastrowid
        return task_id

    def get_tasks(self) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
        """
        Liefert alle Tasks als Liste von Dictionaries.
        Die Felder sind bereits benannt (NR, Name, Beschreibung, Status, Typ).
        """
        cur = self.conn.execute(
            """
            SELECT
                t.task_id,
                t.title,
                t.description,
                tt.type_name,
                s.status_name,
                t.created_at,
                t.updated_at
            FROM task t
            JOIN task_type tt ON t.type_id = tt.type_id
            JOIN status s ON t.status_id = s.status_id
            ORDER BY t.task_id ASC
            """
        )
        rows = cur.fetchall()
        tasks = [
            {
                "id": r[0],
                "title": r[1],
                "description": r[2],
                "type": r[3],
                "status": r[4],
                "created_at": r[5],
                "updated_at": r[6],
            }
            for r in rows
        ]
        return tasks

    def update_status(self, task_id: int, new_status_name: str) -> None:
        """
        √Ñndert den Status eines Tasks und schreibt einen Eintrag in die Historie.
        """
        new_status_id = self._get_status_id(new_status_name)

        with self._lock, self.conn:
            # Aktuellen Status holen
            cur = self.conn.execute(
                "SELECT status_id FROM task WHERE task_id = ?", (task_id,)
            )
            row = cur.fetchone()
            if not row:
                raise ValueError(f"Task mit ID {task_id} existiert nicht.")
            old_status_id = row[0]

            # Keine √Ñnderung, wenn gleich
            if old_status_id == new_status_id:
                return

            # Status aktualisieren
            self.conn.execute(
                """
                UPDATE task
                SET status_id = ?, updated_at = datetime('now')
                WHERE task_id = ?
                """,
                (new_status_id, task_id),
            )

            # Historie‚ÄëEintrag
            self.conn.execute(
                """
                INSERT INTO task_history (task_id, old_status_id, new_status_id)
                VALUES (?, ?, ?)
                """,
                (task_id, old_status_id, new_status_id),
            )

    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    # Hilfs‚ÄëMethoden f√ºr Tests (optional)
    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    def delete_all(self) -> None:
        """L√∂scht s√§mtliche Daten ‚Äì nur f√ºr Test‚ÄëUmgebungen gedacht."""
        with self._lock, self.conn:
            self.conn.executescript(
                """
                DELETE FROM task_history;
                DELETE FROM task;
                """
            )
```

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

"""
Dialog zum Anlegen eines neuen Tasks (Bug / Idea).
"""

from PyQt5 import QtWidgets, QtCore
import html

class AddTaskDialog(QtWidgets.QDialog):
    def __init__(self, parent=None):
        super().__init__(parent)
        self.setWindowTitle("Neuen Task hinzuf√ºgen")
        self.setModal(True)
        self.resize(400, 300)

        # Layout
        layout = QtWidgets.QVBoxLayout(self)

        # Titel
        self.title_edit = QtWidgets.QLineEdit(self)
        self.title_edit.setPlaceholderText("Titel (max. 150 Zeichen)")
        layout.addWidget(QtWidgets.QLabel("Titel:", self))
        layout.addWidget(self.title_edit)

        # Beschreibung
        self.desc_edit = QtWidgets.QPlainTextEdit(self)
        self.desc_edit.setPlaceholderText("Beschreibung")
        layout.addWidget(QtWidgets.QLabel("Beschreibung:", self))
        layout.addWidget(self.desc_edit)

        # Typ (Bug / Idea)
        self.type_combo = QtWidgets.QComboBox(self)
        self.type_combo.addItems(["Bug", "Idea"])
        layout.addWidget(QtWidgets.QLabel("Typ:", self))
        layout.addWidget(self.type_combo)

        # Buttons
        btn_box = QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox(
            QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox.Ok | QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox.Cancel,
            QtCore.Qt.Horizontal,
            self,
        )
        btn_box.accepted.connect(self.accept)
        btn_box.rejected.connect(self.reject)
        layout.addWidget(btn_box)

    def get_data(self) -> dict:
        """
        Gibt ein Dictionary mit den (bereinigten) Eingaben zur√ºck.
        """
        title = self.title_edit.text().strip()[:150]  # max. L√§nge
        description = self.desc_edit.toPlainText().strip()
        # Escape HTML‚ÄëZeichen (SEC‚Äë003)
        description = html.escape(description)
        return {
            "title": title,
            "description": description,
            "type_name": self.type_combo.currentText(),
        }
```

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

"""
Entry point for the Todo‚ÄëList desktop application.
"""

import sys
import os
from PyQt5 import QtWidgets, QtGui

# Ensure the package directory is on the import path
BASE_DIR = os.path.abspath(os.path.dirname(__file__))
if BASE_DIR not in sys.path:
    sys.path.append(BASE_DIR)

from todolist.db import TodoDB
from todolist.ui_mainwindow import MainWindow

def main() -> None:
    """Start the Qt application."""
    app = QtWidgets.QApplication(sys.argv)

    # Load the global stylesheet (glass‚Äëmorphism look)
    style_path = os.path.join(BASE_DIR, "todolist", "style.qss")
    if os.path.exists(style_path):
        with open(style_path, "r", encoding="utf-8") as f:
            app.setStyleSheet(f.read())

    # Initialise the database (default file in the same folder)
    db_path = os.path.join(BASE_DIR, "todolist.db")
    db = TodoDB(db_path)

    # Create and show the main window
    window = MainWindow(db)
    window.show()
    sys.exit(app.exec_())

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
```

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

"""
SQLite‚ÄëWrapper f√ºr die Todo‚ÄëList‚ÄëApplikation.
Stellt CRUD‚ÄëOperationen bereit und sorgt daf√ºr,
dass Verbindungen immer korrekt geschlossen werden.
"""

import sqlite3
import os
import threading
import re
from typing import List, Dict, Any

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
# Hilfsfunktion: Eingaben sanitizen (Security‚ÄëTask SEC‚Äë001)
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
def _sanitize_text(text: str) -> str:
    """
    Entfernt potenziell gef√§hrliche HTML‚ÄëTags und Zeichen.
    """
    # Entferne spitze Klammern ‚Äì einfachste XSS‚ÄëPr√§vention
    return re.sub(r"[<>]", "", text)


class TodoDB:
    """
    Datenbank‚ÄëAbstraktions‚ÄëKlasse.
    Nutzt einen einzelnen Connection‚ÄëThread‚Äësicher (check_same_thread=False)
    und stellt Kontext‚ÄëManager‚ÄëUnterst√ºtzung bereit.
    """

    _lock = threading.Lock()

    def __init__(self, db_path: str = "todolist.db"):
        self.db_path = os.path.abspath(db_path)
        self.conn: sqlite3.Connection = sqlite3.connect(
            self.db_path, check_same_thread=False, isolation_level=None
        )
        self.conn.execute("PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON;")
        self._create_schema()

    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    # Schema‚ÄëErstellung (idempotent)
    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    def _create_schema(self) -> None:
        with self.conn:
            self.conn.executescript(
                """
                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS task_type (
                    type_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
                    type_name TEXT    NOT NULL UNIQUE CHECK (length(type_name) <= 30)
                );
                INSERT OR IGNORE INTO task_type (type_name) VALUES ('Bug'), ('Idea');

                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS status (
                    status_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
                    status_name TEXT    NOT NULL UNIQUE CHECK (length(status_name) <= 30)
                );
                INSERT OR IGNORE INTO status (status_name) VALUES
                    ('New'), ('Open'), ('In Review'), ('Resolved'), ('Closed');

                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS task (
                    task_id      INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
                    title        TEXT    NOT NULL CHECK (length(title) <= 150),
                    description  TEXT    NOT NULL,
                    type_id      INTEGER NOT NULL,
                    status_id    INTEGER NOT NULL,
                    created_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
                    updated_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
                    FOREIGN KEY (type_id)   REFERENCES task_type (type_id)   ON DELETE RESTRICT ON UPDATE CASCADE,
                    FOREIGN KEY (status_id) REFERENCES status    (status_id) ON DELETE RESTRICT ON UPDATE CASCADE
                );

                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS task_history (
                    history_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
                    task_id      INTEGER NOT NULL,
                    old_status_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
                    new_status_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
                    changed_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
                    FOREIGN KEY (task_id)       REFERENCES task (task_id)       ON DELETE CASCADE ON UPDATE CASCADE,
                    FOREIGN KEY (old_status_id) REFERENCES status (status_id) ON DELETE RESTRICT ON UPDATE CASCADE,
                    FOREIGN KEY (new_status_id) REFERENCES status (status_id) ON DELETE RESTRICT ON UPDATE CASCADE
                );

                CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_task_title ON task(title);
                CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_task_type_status ON task(type_id, status_id);
                CREATE INDEX IF NOT EXISTS idx_hist_task ON task_history(task_id);
                """
            )

    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    # Kontext‚ÄëManager‚ÄëMethoden
    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    def __enter__(self) -> "TodoDB":
        return self

    def __exit__(self, exc_type, exc_val, exc_tb) -> None:
        self.close()

    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    # √ñffentliche API
    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    def close(self) -> None:
        """Schlie√üt die Datenbankverbindung (idempotent)."""
        with self._lock:
            if getattr(self, "conn", None):
                self.conn.close()
                self.conn = None

    def __del__(self):
        """Sicherstellen, dass die Verbindung beim Garbage‚ÄëCollection geschlossen wird."""
        self.close()

    def _get_type_id(self, type_name: str) -> int:
        cur = self.conn.execute(
            "SELECT type_id FROM task_type WHERE type_name = ?", (type_name,)
        )
        row = cur.fetchone()
        if not row:
            raise ValueError(f"Unbekannter Task‚ÄëTyp: {type_name}")
        return row[0]

    def _get_status_id(self, status_name: str) -> int:
        cur = self.conn.execute(
            "SELECT status_id FROM status WHERE status_name = ?", (status_name,)
        )
        row = cur.fetchone()
        if not row:
            raise ValueError(f"Unbekannter Status: {status_name}")
        return row[0]

    def add_task(
        self,
        title: str,
        description: str,
        type_name: str = "Bug",
        status_name: str = "New",
    ) -> int:
        """
        F√ºgt einen neuen Task ein und gibt die erzeugte task_id zur√ºck.
        Eingaben werden sanitisiert (SEC‚Äë001).
        """
        title = _sanitize_text(title.strip())[:150]
        description = _sanitize_text(description.strip())

        type_id = self._get_type_id(type_name)
        status_id = self._get_status_id(status_name)

        with self._lock, self.conn:
            cur = self.conn.execute(
                """
                INSERT INTO task (title, description, type_id, status_id)
                VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?)
                """,
                (title, description, type_id, status_id),
            )
            task_id = cur.lastrowid
        return task_id

    def get_tasks(self) -> List[Dict[str, Any]]:
        """
        Liefert alle Tasks als Liste von Dictionaries.
        Die Felder sind bereits benannt (NR, Name, Beschreibung, Typ, Status).
        """
        cur = self.conn.execute(
            """
            SELECT
                t.task_id,
                t.title,
                t.description,
                tt.type_name,
                s.status_name,
                t.created_at,
                t.updated_at
            FROM task t
            JOIN task_type tt ON t.type_id = tt.type_id
            JOIN status s ON t.status_id = s.status_id
            ORDER BY t.task_id ASC
            """
        )
        rows = cur.fetchall()
        tasks = [
            {
                "id": r[0],
                "title": r[1],
                "description": r[2],
                "type": r[3],
                "status": r[4],
                "created_at": r[5],
                "updated_at": r[6],
            }
            for r in rows
        ]
        return tasks

    def update_status(self, task_id: int, new_status_name: str) -> None:
        """
        √Ñndert den Status eines Tasks und schreibt einen Eintrag in die Historie.
        """
        new_status_id = self._get_status_id(new_status_name)

        with self._lock, self.conn:
            # Aktuellen Status holen
            cur = self.conn.execute(
                "SELECT status_id FROM task WHERE task_id = ?", (task_id,)
            )
            row = cur.fetchone()
            if not row:
                raise ValueError(f"Task mit ID {task_id} existiert nicht.")
            old_status_id = row[0]

            # Keine √Ñnderung, wenn gleich
            if old_status_id == new_status_id:
                return

            # Status aktualisieren
            self.conn.execute(
                """
                UPDATE task
                SET status_id = ?, updated_at = datetime('now')
                WHERE task_id = ?
                """,
                (new_status_id, task_id),
            )

            # Historie‚ÄëEintrag
            self.conn.execute(
                """
                INSERT INTO task_history (task_id, old_status_id, new_status_id)
                VALUES (?, ?, ?)
                """,
                (task_id, old_status_id, new_status_id),
            )

    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    # Hilfs‚ÄëMethoden f√ºr Tests (optional)
    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    def delete_all(self) -> None:
        """L√∂scht s√§mtliche Daten ‚Äì nur f√ºr Test‚ÄëUmgebungen gedacht."""
        with self._lock, self.conn:
            self.conn.executescript(
                """
                DELETE FROM task_history;
                DELETE FROM task;
                """
            )
```

```python
#!/usr/bin/env python
# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-

"""
Dialog zum Anlegen eines neuen Tasks (Bug / Idea).
"""

from PyQt5 import QtWidgets, QtCore
import html

class AddTaskDialog(QtWidgets.QDialog):
    def __init__(self, parent=None):
        super().__init__(parent)
        self.setWindowTitle("Neuen Task hinzuf√ºgen")
        self.setModal(True)
        self.resize(400, 300)

        # Layout
        layout = QtWidgets.QVBoxLayout(self)

        # Titel
        self.title_edit = QtWidgets.QLineEdit(self)
        self.title_edit.setPlaceholderText("Titel (max. 150 Zeichen)")
        layout.addWidget(QtWidgets.QLabel("Titel:", self))
        layout.addWidget(self.title_edit)

        # Beschreibung
        self.desc_edit = QtWidgets.QPlainTextEdit(self)
        self.desc_edit.setPlaceholderText("Beschreibung")
        layout.addWidget(QtWidgets.QLabel("Beschreibung:", self))
        layout.addWidget(self.desc_edit)

        # Typ (Bug / Idea)
        self.type_combo = QtWidgets.QComboBox(self)
        self.type_combo.addItems(["Bug", "Idea"])
        layout.addWidget(QtWidgets.QLabel("Typ:", self))
        layout.addWidget(self.type_combo)

        # Buttons
        btn_box = QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox(
            QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox.Ok | QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox.Cancel,
            QtCore.Qt.Horizontal,
            self,
        )
        btn_box.accepted.connect(self.accept)
        btn_box.rejected.connect(self.reject)
        layout.addWidget(btn_box)

    def get_data(self) -> dict:
        """
        Gibt ein Dictionary mit den (bereinigten) Eingaben zur√ºck.
        """
        title = self.title_edit.text().strip()[:150]  # max. L√§nge
        description = self.desc_edit.toPlainText().strip()
        # Escape HTML‚ÄëZeichen (SEC‚Äë003)
        description = html.escape(description)
        return {
            "title": title,
            "description": description,
            "type_name": self.type_combo.currentText(),
        }
```

class StatusComboDelegate(QtWidgets.QStyledItemDelegate):
    """
    Delegate, die in der Status‚ÄëSpalte ein QComboBox‚ÄëWidget einsetzt,
    um den Status inline zu √§ndern.
    """
    def __init__(self, parent, db):
        super().__init__(parent)
        self.db = db
        # Alle m√∂glichen Status‚ÄëNamen holen (einmalig)
        self.status_names = [row[0] for row in self.db.conn.execute("SELECT status_name FROM status ORDER BY status_id")]

    def createEditor(self, parent, option, index):
        combo = QtWidgets.QComboBox(parent)
        combo.addItems(self.status_names)
        return combo

    def setEditorData(self, editor, index):
        current_text = index.data(QtCore.Qt.DisplayRole)
        idx = self.status_names.index(current_text) if current_text in self.status_names else 0
        editor.setCurrentIndex(idx)

    def setModelData(self, editor, model, index):
        new_status = editor.currentText()
        task_id = model.item(index.row(), 0).data(QtCore.Qt.UserRole)  # NR stored in UserRole
        # Update DB
        self.db.update_status(task_id, new_status)
        # Update model
        model.setData(index, new_status)

    def updateEditorGeometry(self, editor, option, index):
        editor.setGeometry(option.rect)

import os
import sqlite3
from typing import List, Tuple, Optional, Dict


class TodoDB:
    """
    Simple wrapper around a SQLite database that stores tasks,
    their type (Bug / Idea) and status.
    All connections are opened **per operation** and closed
    immediately afterwards ‚Äì this guarantees that the DB file
    is never locked when the test‚Äësuite removes the temporary
    directory.
    """

    def __init__(self, db_path: str = "todolist.db"):
        self.db_path = db_path
        self._ensure_db()

    # ------------------------------------------------------------------ #
    #  Private helpers
    # ------------------------------------------------------------------ #
    def _connect(self) -> sqlite3.Connection:
        """Open a new connection with foreign‚Äëkeys enabled."""
        conn = sqlite3.connect(self.db_path, detect_types=sqlite3.PARSE_DECLTYPES)
        conn.execute("PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON;")
        conn.row_factory = sqlite3.Row
        return conn

    def _ensure_db(self) -> None:
        """Create the schema if the DB file does not exist yet."""
        if os.path.exists(self.db_path):
            # schema already present ‚Äì nothing to do
            return

        schema = """
        PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON;

        CREATE TABLE task_type (
            type_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
            type_name TEXT    NOT NULL UNIQUE CHECK (length(type_name) <= 30)
        );

        INSERT INTO task_type (type_name) VALUES ('Bug'), ('Idea');

        CREATE TABLE status (
            status_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
            status_name TEXT    NOT NULL UNIQUE CHECK (length(status_name) <= 30)
        );

        INSERT INTO status (status_name) VALUES
            ('New'), ('Open'), ('In Review'), ('Resolved'), ('Closed');

        CREATE TABLE task (
            task_id      INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
            title        TEXT    NOT NULL CHECK (length(title) <= 150),
            description  TEXT    NOT NULL,
            type_id      INTEGER NOT NULL,
            status_id    INTEGER NOT NULL,
            created_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
            updated_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
            CONSTRAINT fk_task_type
                FOREIGN KEY (type_id) REFERENCES task_type (type_id)
                ON DELETE RESTRICT ON UPDATE CASCADE,
            CONSTRAINT fk_task_status
                FOREIGN KEY (status_id) REFERENCES status (status_id)
                ON DELETE RESTRICT ON UPDATE CASCADE
        );

        CREATE INDEX idx_task_title ON task(title);
        CREATE INDEX idx_task_type_status ON task(type_id, status_id);
        """
        conn = self._connect()
        try:
            conn.executescript(schema)
            conn.commit()
        finally:
            conn.close()

    # ------------------------------------------------------------------ #
    #  Public API
    # ------------------------------------------------------------------ #
    def add_task(
        self,
        title: str,
        description: str,
        type_name: str = "Bug",
        status_name: str = "New",
    ) -> int:
        """
        Insert a new task and return its autogenerated ``task_id``.
        """
        conn = self._connect()
        try:
            cur = conn.cursor()
            cur.execute(
                """
                INSERT INTO task (title, description, type_id, status_id)
                VALUES (
                    ?, ?, 
                    (SELECT type_id FROM task_type WHERE type_name = ?),
                    (SELECT status_id FROM status WHERE status_name = ?)
                )
                """,
                (title, description, type_name, status_name),
            )
            conn.commit()
            return cur.lastrowid
        finally:
            conn.close()

    def get_task(self, task_id: int) -> Optional[Dict]:
        """Return a dict with all columns for the given ``task_id``."""
        conn = self._connect()
        try:
            cur = conn.cursor()
            cur.execute(
                """
                SELECT t.task_id, t.title, t.description,
                       tt.type_name, s.status_name,
                       t.created_at, t.updated_at
                FROM task t
                JOIN task_type tt ON t.type_id = tt.type_id
                JOIN status s      ON t.status_id = s.status_id
                WHERE t.task_id = ?
                """,
                (task_id,),
            )
            row = cur.fetchone()
            return dict(row) if row else None
        finally:
            conn.close()

    def update_status(self, task_id: int, new_status_name: str) -> None:
        """
        Change the status of a task and record the change in ``task_history``.
        (The history table is optional ‚Äì we create it lazily if it does not exist.)
        """
        conn = self._connect()
        try:
            cur = conn.cursor()
            # fetch old status id for history
            cur.execute(
                "SELECT status_id FROM task WHERE task_id = ?", (task_id,)
            )
            old_status_row = cur.fetchone()
            if not old_status_row:
                raise ValueError(f"Task {task_id} does not exist")
            old_status_id = old_status_row["status_id"]

            # fetch new status id
            cur.execute(
                "SELECT status_id FROM status WHERE status_name = ?",
                (new_status_name,),
            )
            new_status_row = cur.fetchone()
            if not new_status_row:
                raise ValueError(f"Status '{new_status_name}' does not exist")
            new_status_id = new_status_row["status_id"]

            # update task
            cur.execute(
                """
                UPDATE task
                SET status_id = ?, updated_at = datetime('now')
                WHERE task_id = ?
                """,
                (new_status_id, task_id),
            )

            # ensure history table exists
            cur.execute(
                """
                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS task_history (
                    history_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
                    task_id      INTEGER NOT NULL,
                    old_status_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
                    new_status_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
                    changed_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
                    CONSTRAINT fk_hist_task
                        FOREIGN KEY (task_id) REFERENCES task (task_id)
                        ON DELETE CASCADE ON UPDATE CASCADE,
                    CONSTRAINT fk_hist_old_status
                        FOREIGN KEY (old_status_id) REFERENCES status (status_id)
                        ON DELETE RESTRICT ON UPDATE CASCADE,
                    CONSTRAINT fk_hist_new_status
                        FOREIGN KEY (new_status_id) REFERENCES status (status_id)
                        ON DELETE RESTRICT ON UPDATE CASCADE
                );
                """
            )
            # insert history entry
            cur.execute(
                """
                INSERT INTO task_history (task_id, old_status_id, new_status_id)
                VALUES (?, ?, ?)
                """,
                (task_id, old_status_id, new_status_id),
            )
            conn.commit()
        finally:
            conn.close()

    def list_tasks(self) -> List[Dict]:
        """Return all tasks as a list of dictionaries."""
        conn = self._connect()
        try:
            cur = conn.cursor()
            cur.execute(
                """
                SELECT t.task_id, t.title, t.description,
                       tt.type_name, s.status_name,
                       t.created_at, t.updated_at
                FROM task t
                JOIN task_type tt ON t.type_id = tt.type_id
                JOIN status s      ON t.status_id = s.status_id
                ORDER BY t.task_id ASC
                """
            )
            rows = cur.fetchall()
            return [dict(row) for row in rows]
        finally:
            conn.close()

import sys
import os
from PyQt5 import QtCore, QtGui, QtWidgets
from .db import TodoDB

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
#  Helper: Glass‚Äëmorphism style sheet (semi‚Äëtransparent, blur‚Äëlike effect)
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
GLASS_STYLE = """
QWidget {
    background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.15);
    border-radius: 12px;
    color: #ffffff;
}
QLineEdit, QTextEdit, QComboBox {
    background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.25);
    border: 1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.3);
    border-radius: 8px;
    padding: 4px;
    color: #000000;
}
QPushButton {
    background: rgba(255,255,255,0.3);
    border: none;
    border-radius: 8px;
    padding: 6px 12px;
    color: #000000;
}
QPushButton:hover {
    background: rgba(255,255,255,0.45);
}
QTableWidget {
    background: rgba(255,255,255,0.2);
    gridline-color: rgba(255,255,255,0.1);
    selection-background-color: rgba(255,255,255,0.4);
}
"""

class AddTaskDialog(QtWidgets.QDialog):
    def __init__(self, parent=None):
        super().__init__(parent)
        self.setWindowTitle("Neuen Task hinzuf√ºgen")
        self.setModal(True)
        self.setStyleSheet(GLASS_STYLE)

        self.title_edit = QtWidgets.QLineEdit()
        self.title_edit.setPlaceholderText("Titel")
        self.desc_edit = QtWidgets.QTextEdit()
        self.desc_edit.setPlaceholderText("Beschreibung")
        self.type_combo = QtWidgets.QComboBox()
        self.type_combo.addItems(["Bug", "Idea"])
        self.status_combo = QtWidgets.QComboBox()
        self.status_combo.addItems(["New", "Open", "In Review", "Resolved", "Closed"])

        form = QtWidgets.QFormLayout()
        form.addRow("Titel:", self.title_edit)
        form.addRow("Beschreibung:", self.desc_edit)
        form.addRow("Typ:", self.type_combo)
        form.addRow("Status:", self.status_combo)

        btn_box = QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox(
            QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox.Ok | QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox.Cancel
        )
        btn_box.accepted.connect(self.accept)
        btn_box.rejected.connect(self.reject)

        layout = QtWidgets.QVBoxLayout()
        layout.addLayout(form)
        layout.addWidget(btn_box)
        self.setLayout(layout)

    def get_data(self):
        return {
            "title": self.title_edit.text().strip(),
            "description": self.desc_edit.toPlainText().strip(),
            "type": self.type_combo.currentText(),
            "status": self.status_combo.currentText(),
        }

class MainWindow(QtWidgets.QMainWindow):
    def __init__(self, db_path: str = "todolist.db"):
        super().__init__()
        self.setWindowTitle("ü™≤ Bug‚Äë & Idea‚ÄëTodo‚ÄëListe")
        self.resize(900, 600)
        self.db = TodoDB(db_path)

        # Central widget with glass effect
        central = QtWidgets.QWidget()
        central.setStyleSheet(GLASS_STYLE)
        self.setCentralWidget(central)

        # Table
        self.table = QtWidgets.QTableWidget()
        self.table.setColumnCount(5)
        self.table.setHorizontalHeaderLabels(
            ["NR", "Name", "Beschreibung", "Typ", "Status"]
        )
        self.table.horizontalHeader().setStretchLastSection(True)
        self.table.setSelectionBehavior(QtWidgets.QAbstractItemView.SelectRows)
        self.table.setEditTriggers(QtWidgets.QAbstractItemView.NoEditTriggers)

        # Buttons
        add_btn = QtWidgets.QPushButton("‚ûï Hinzuf√ºgen")
        add_btn.clicked.connect(self.add_task)
        refresh_btn = QtWidgets.QPushButton("üîÑ Aktualisieren")
        refresh_btn.clicked.connect(self.load_tasks)
        change_status_btn = QtWidgets.QPushButton("üîÅ Status √§ndern")
        change_status_btn.clicked.connect(self.change_status)

        btn_layout = QtWidgets.QHBoxLayout()
        btn_layout.addWidget(add_btn)
        btn_layout.addWidget(change_status_btn)
        btn_layout.addStretch()
        btn_layout.addWidget(refresh_btn)

        layout = QtWidgets.QVBoxLayout()
        layout.addLayout(btn_layout)
        layout.addWidget(self.table)
        central.setLayout(layout)

        # Load data
        self.load_tasks()

    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    #  UI actions
    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    def load_tasks(self):
        tasks = self.db.list_tasks()
        self.table.setRowCount(len(tasks))
        for row_idx, task in enumerate(tasks):
            self.table.setItem(row_idx, 0, QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem(str(task["task_id"])))
            self.table.setItem(row_idx, 1, QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem(task["title"]))
            self.table.setItem(row_idx, 2, QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem(task["description"]))
            self.table.setItem(row_idx, 3, QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem(task["type_name"]))
            self.table.setItem(row_idx, 4, QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem(task["status_name"]))
        self.table.resizeColumnsToContents()

    def add_task(self):
        dlg = AddTaskDialog(self)
        if dlg.exec_() == QtWidgets.QDialog.Accepted:
            data = dlg.get_data()
            if not data["title"]:
                QtWidgets.QMessageBox.warning(self, "Fehler", "Titel darf nicht leer sein.")
                return
            self.db.add_task(
                title=data["title"],
                description=data["description"],
                type_name=data["type"],
                status_name=data["status"],
            )
            self.load_tasks()

    def change_status(self):
        selected = self.table.selectionModel().selectedRows()
        if not selected:
            QtWidgets.QMessageBox.information(self, "Hinweis", "Bitte zuerst einen Task ausw√§hlen.")
            return
        row = selected[0].row()
        task_id = int(self.table.item(row, 0).text())
        current_status = self.table.item(row, 4).text()

        # Dialog f√ºr neue Statusauswahl
        status_dialog = QtWidgets.QInputDialog(self)
        status_dialog.setWindowTitle("Status √§ndern")
        status_dialog.setLabelText(f"Aktueller Status: {current_status}\nNeuen Status w√§hlen:")
        status_dialog.setComboBoxItems(["New", "Open", "In Review", "Resolved", "Closed"])
        status_dialog.setOption(QtWidgets.QInputDialog.UseListViewForComboBoxItems)
        if status_dialog.exec_() == QtWidgets.QDialog.Accepted:
            new_status = status_dialog.textValue()
            try:
                self.db.update_status(task_id, new_status)
                self.load_tasks()
            except Exception as e:
                QtWidgets.QMessageBox.critical(self, "Fehler", str(e))

def main():
    app = QtWidgets.QApplication(sys.argv)
    # Enable high‚ÄëDPI scaling for crisp glass effect
    QtWidgets.QApplication.setAttribute(QtCore.Qt.AA_EnableHighDpiScaling, True)
    win = MainWindow()
    win.show()
    sys.exit(app.exec_())

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()

# Ensure the package root is on sys.path
import sys
sys.path.append(os.path.abspath(os.path.join(os.path.dirname(__file__), "..")))

from todolist.db import TodoDB


@pytest.fixture
def fresh_db():
    """Create a temporary directory with a fresh SQLite DB."""
    with tempfile.TemporaryDirectory() as tmpdir:
        db_path = os.path.join(tmpdir, "test_todolist.db")
        db = TodoDB(db_path)
        yield db, db_path
        # The fixture ensures the temporary directory (and thus the DB file)
        # is removed after the test. Because TodoDB opens a new connection for
        # each operation and closes it immediately, the file is not locked.

        title="Crash on login",
        description="App aborts with SIGSEGV when wrong password is entered.",
        type_name="Bug",
        status_name="New",
    )

import os
import sqlite3
from typing import List, Dict, Optional


class TodoDB:
    """
    Wrapper around a SQLite database that stores tasks, their type (Bug / Idea)
    and status. Each operation opens a fresh connection and closes it immediately
    ‚Äì this prevents the database file from staying locked during the test suite
    teardown.
    """

    def __init__(self, db_path: str = "todolist.db"):
        self.db_path = db_path
        self._ensure_db()

    # ------------------------------------------------------------------ #
    #  Private helpers
    # ------------------------------------------------------------------ #
    def _connect(self) -> sqlite3.Connection:
        """Open a new connection with foreign‚Äëkeys enabled."""
        conn = sqlite3.connect(self.db_path, detect_types=sqlite3.PARSE_DECLTYPES)
        conn.execute("PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON;")
        conn.row_factory = sqlite3.Row
        return conn

    def _ensure_db(self) -> None:
        """Create the schema if the DB file does not exist yet."""
        if os.path.exists(self.db_path):
            return  # schema already present

        schema = """
        PRAGMA foreign_keys = ON;

        CREATE TABLE task_type (
            type_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
            type_name TEXT    NOT NULL UNIQUE CHECK (length(type_name) <= 30)
        );

        INSERT INTO task_type (type_name) VALUES ('Bug'), ('Idea');

        CREATE TABLE status (
            status_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
            status_name TEXT    NOT NULL UNIQUE CHECK (length(status_name) <= 30)
        );

        INSERT INTO status (status_name) VALUES
            ('New'), ('Open'), ('In Review'), ('Resolved'), ('Closed');

        CREATE TABLE task (
            task_id      INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
            title        TEXT    NOT NULL CHECK (length(title) <= 150),
            description  TEXT    NOT NULL,
            type_id      INTEGER NOT NULL,
            status_id    INTEGER NOT NULL,
            created_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
            updated_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
            CONSTRAINT fk_task_type
                FOREIGN KEY (type_id) REFERENCES task_type (type_id)
                ON DELETE RESTRICT ON UPDATE CASCADE,
            CONSTRAINT fk_task_status
                FOREIGN KEY (status_id) REFERENCES status (status_id)
                ON DELETE RESTRICT ON UPDATE CASCADE
        );

        CREATE INDEX idx_task_title ON task(title);
        CREATE INDEX idx_task_type_status ON task(type_id, status_id);
        """
        conn = self._connect()
        try:
            conn.executescript(schema)
            conn.commit()
        finally:
            conn.close()

    # ------------------------------------------------------------------ #
    #  Public API
    # ------------------------------------------------------------------ #
    def add_task(
        self,
        title: str,
        description: str,
        type_name: str = "Bug",
        status_name: str = "New",
    ) -> int:
        """Insert a new task and return its autogenerated ``task_id``."""
        conn = self._connect()
        try:
            cur = conn.cursor()
            cur.execute(
                """
                INSERT INTO task (title, description, type_id, status_id)
                VALUES (
                    ?, ?, 
                    (SELECT type_id FROM task_type WHERE type_name = ?),
                    (SELECT status_id FROM status WHERE status_name = ?)
                )
                """,
                (title, description, type_name, status_name),
            )
            conn.commit()
            return cur.lastrowid
        finally:
            conn.close()

    def get_task(self, task_id: int) -> Optional[Dict]:
        """Return a dict with all columns for the given ``task_id``."""
        conn = self._connect()
        try:
            cur = conn.cursor()
            cur.execute(
                """
                SELECT t.task_id, t.title, t.description,
                       tt.type_name, s.status_name,
                       t.created_at, t.updated_at
                FROM task t
                JOIN task_type tt ON t.type_id = tt.type_id
                JOIN status s      ON t.status_id = s.status_id
                WHERE t.task_id = ?
                """,
                (task_id,),
            )
            row = cur.fetchone()
            return dict(row) if row else None
        finally:
            conn.close()

    def update_status(self, task_id: int, new_status_name: str) -> None:
        """
        Change the status of a task and record the change in ``task_history``.
        The history table is created lazily on first use.
        """
        conn = self._connect()
        try:
            cur = conn.cursor()
            # old status
            cur.execute("SELECT status_id FROM task WHERE task_id = ?", (task_id,))
            old_row = cur.fetchone()
            if not old_row:
                raise ValueError(f"Task {task_id} does not exist")
            old_status_id = old_row["status_id"]

            # new status id
            cur.execute(
                "SELECT status_id FROM status WHERE status_name = ?", (new_status_name,)
            )
            new_row = cur.fetchone()
            if not new_row:
                raise ValueError(f"Status '{new_status_name}' does not exist")
            new_status_id = new_row["status_id"]

            # update task
            cur.execute(
                """
                UPDATE task
                SET status_id = ?, updated_at = datetime('now')
                WHERE task_id = ?
                """,
                (new_status_id, task_id),
            )

            # ensure history table exists
            cur.execute(
                """
                CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS task_history (
                    history_id   INTEGER PRIMARY KEY AUTOINCREMENT,
                    task_id      INTEGER NOT NULL,
                    old_status_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
                    new_status_id INTEGER NOT NULL,
                    changed_at   DATETIME NOT NULL DEFAULT (datetime('now')),
                    CONSTRAINT fk_hist_task
                        FOREIGN KEY (task_id) REFERENCES task (task_id)
                        ON DELETE CASCADE ON UPDATE CASCADE,
                    CONSTRAINT fk_hist_old_status
                        FOREIGN KEY (old_status_id) REFERENCES status (status_id)
                        ON DELETE RESTRICT ON UPDATE CASCADE,
                    CONSTRAINT fk_hist_new_status
                        FOREIGN KEY (new_status_id) REFERENCES status (status_id)
                        ON DELETE RESTRICT ON UPDATE CASCADE
                );
                """
            )
            # insert history entry
            cur.execute(
                """
                INSERT INTO task_history (task_id, old_status_id, new_status_id)
                VALUES (?, ?, ?)
                """,
                (task_id, old_status_id, new_status_id),
            )
            conn.commit()
        finally:
            conn.close()

    def list_tasks(self) -> List[Dict]:
        """Return all tasks as a list of dictionaries ordered by ``task_id``."""
        conn = self._connect()
        try:
            cur = conn.cursor()
            cur.execute(
                """
                SELECT t.task_id, t.title, t.description,
                       tt.type_name, s.status_name,
                       t.created_at, t.updated_at
                FROM task t
                JOIN task_type tt ON t.type_id = tt.type_id
                JOIN status s      ON t.status_id = s.status_id
                ORDER BY t.task_id ASC
                """
            )
            rows = cur.fetchall()
            return [dict(row) for row in rows]
        finally:
            conn.close()

import sys
from PyQt5 import QtCore, QtWidgets
from .db import TodoDB

# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
#  Glass‚Äëmorphism style sheet (semi‚Äëtransparent, blur‚Äëlike effect)
# ----------------------------------------------------------------------
GLASS_STYLE = """
QWidget {
    background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.15);
    border-radius: 12px;
    color: #ffffff;
}
QLineEdit, QTextEdit, QComboBox {
    background: rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.25);
    border: 1px solid rgba(255,255,255,0.3);
    border-radius: 8px;
    padding: 4px;
    color: #000000;
}
QPushButton {
    background: rgba(255,255,255,0.3);
    border: none;
    border-radius: 8px;
    padding: 6px 12px;
    color: #000000;
}
QPushButton:hover {
    background: rgba(255,255,255,0.45);
}
QTableWidget {
    background: rgba(255,255,255,0.2);
    gridline-color: rgba(255,255,255,0.1);
    selection-background-color: rgba(255,255,255,0.4);
}
"""

class AddTaskDialog(QtWidgets.QDialog):
    def __init__(self, parent=None):
        super().__init__(parent)
        self.setWindowTitle("Neuen Task hinzuf√ºgen")
        self.setModal(True)
        self.setStyleSheet(GLASS_STYLE)

        self.title_edit = QtWidgets.QLineEdit()
        self.title_edit.setPlaceholderText("Titel")
        self.desc_edit = QtWidgets.QTextEdit()
        self.desc_edit.setPlaceholderText("Beschreibung")
        self.type_combo = QtWidgets.QComboBox()
        self.type_combo.addItems(["Bug", "Idea"])
        self.status_combo = QtWidgets.QComboBox()
        self.status_combo.addItems(["New", "Open", "In Review", "Resolved", "Closed"])

        form = QtWidgets.QFormLayout()
        form.addRow("Titel:", self.title_edit)
        form.addRow("Beschreibung:", self.desc_edit)
        form.addRow("Typ:", self.type_combo)
        form.addRow("Status:", self.status_combo)

        btn_box = QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox(
            QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox.Ok | QtWidgets.QDialogButtonBox.Cancel
        )
        btn_box.accepted.connect(self.accept)
        btn_box.rejected.connect(self.reject)

        layout = QtWidgets.QVBoxLayout()
        layout.addLayout(form)
        layout.addWidget(btn_box)
        self.setLayout(layout)

    def get_data(self):
        return {
            "title": self.title_edit.text().strip(),
            "description": self.desc_edit.toPlainText().strip(),
            "type": self.type_combo.currentText(),
            "status": self.status_combo.currentText(),
        }

class MainWindow(QtWidgets.QMainWindow):
    def __init__(self, db_path: str = "todolist.db"):
        super().__init__()
        self.setWindowTitle("ü™≤ Bug‚Äë & Idea‚ÄëTodo‚ÄëListe")
        self.resize(900, 600)
        self.db = TodoDB(db_path)

        central = QtWidgets.QWidget()
        central.setStyleSheet(GLASS_STYLE)
        self.setCentralWidget(central)

        # Table
        self.table = QtWidgets.QTableWidget()
        self.table.setColumnCount(5)
        self.table.setHorizontalHeaderLabels(
            ["NR", "Name", "Beschreibung", "Typ", "Status"]
        )
        self.table.horizontalHeader().setStretchLastSection(True)
        self.table.setSelectionBehavior(QtWidgets.QAbstractItemView.SelectRows)
        self.table.setEditTriggers(QtWidgets.QAbstractItemView.NoEditTriggers)

        # Buttons
        add_btn = QtWidgets.QPushButton("‚ûï Hinzuf√ºgen")
        add_btn.clicked.connect(self.add_task)
        refresh_btn = QtWidgets.QPushButton("üîÑ Aktualisieren")
        refresh_btn.clicked.connect(self.load_tasks)
        change_status_btn = QtWidgets.QPushButton("üîÅ Status √§ndern")
        change_status_btn.clicked.connect(self.change_status)

        btn_layout = QtWidgets.QHBoxLayout()
        btn_layout.addWidget(add_btn)
        btn_layout.addWidget(change_status_btn)
        btn_layout.addStretch()
        btn_layout.addWidget(refresh_btn)

        layout = QtWidgets.QVBoxLayout()
        layout.addLayout(btn_layout)
        layout.addWidget(self.table)
        central.setLayout(layout)

        self.load_tasks()

    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    #  UI actions
    # ------------------------------------------------------------------
    def load_tasks(self):
        tasks = self.db.list_tasks()
        self.table.setRowCount(len(tasks))
        for i, task in enumerate(tasks):
            self.table.setItem(i, 0, QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem(str(task["task_id"])))
            self.table.setItem(i, 1, QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem(task["title"]))
            self.table.setItem(i, 2, QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem(task["description"]))
            self.table.setItem(i, 3, QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem(task["type_name"]))
            self.table.setItem(i, 4, QtWidgets.QTableWidgetItem(task["status_name"]))
        self.table.resizeColumnsToContents()

    def add_task(self):
        dlg = AddTaskDialog(self)
        if dlg.exec_() == QtWidgets.QDialog.Accepted:
            data = dlg.get_data()
            if not data["title"]:
                QtWidgets.QMessageBox.warning(self, "Fehler", "Titel darf nicht leer sein.")
                return
            self.db.add_task(
                title=data["title"],
                description=data["description"],
                type_name=data["type"],
                status_name=data["status"],
            )
            self.load_tasks()

    def change_status(self):
        selected = self.table.selectionModel().selectedRows()
        if not selected:
            QtWidgets.QMessageBox.information(self, "Hinweis", "Bitte zuerst einen Task ausw√§hlen.")
            return
        row = selected[0].row()
        task_id = int(self.table.item(row, 0).text())
        current_status = self.table.item(row, 4).text()

        # Simple combo dialog for new status
        new_status, ok = QtWidgets.QInputDialog.getItem(
            self,
            "Status √§ndern",
            f"Aktueller Status: {current_status}\nNeuen Status w√§hlen:",
            ["New", "Open", "In Review", "Resolved", "Closed"],
            editable=False,
        )
        if ok and new_status:
            try:
                self.db.update_status(task_id, new_status)
                self.load_tasks()
            except Exception as e:
                QtWidgets.QMessageBox.critical(self, "Fehler", str(e))

def main():
    app = QtWidgets.QApplication(sys.argv)
    QtWidgets.QApplication.setAttribute(QtCore.Qt.AA_EnableHighDpiScaling, True)
    win = MainWindow()
    win.show()
    sys.exit(app.exec_())

if __name__ == "__main__":
    main()
